question:

question:
choose the correct option.
  • public access member : A
  • private access member : B
  • protected access member : C

description.option: public access member in UML is depicted with '+' symbol
private access member in UML is depicted with '-' symbol.
protected access member in UML is depicted with '#' symbol.

question: Select correct option(s) w.r.t. the below code execution

options.option: a: Code will result in error at #statement1 - “NameError: name 'raise_amount' is not defined”
b: No error. Program runs fine as expected and increases the pay by 4%
c: Will result in error at #statement2 - “NameError: name 'raise_amount' is not defined”

description.A:
Since raise_amount is a class variable and not instance variable so it is not known to the instance.
However, emp_1.raise_amount will not result in error since object will search up in the Employee class when it doesn’t find the variable inside the instance.
description.B: Code will result in Error.Please execute the code for more details.
description.C: emp_1.raise_amount will not result in error since object will search up in the Employee class when it doesn’t find the variable inside the instance.

description.D: option D is correct.Since raise_amount is a class variable when it is set at #stmt2 it is applicable to all the instance variables.However,emp_1.raise_amount at# stmt1 will actually create a copy of same inside the object emp_1.So the valueset at# stmt1 remains unchanged.
